values:
As the dawn of my nervous breakdown cracks over the steamy city landscape of .....oh hell. Who am I kidding?

I'm here to plug my show, Gunga's Drive-In, as seen on America's Most Wan....er...local cable access channel 7 here in Bloomington, Indiana. The web site is www.seriousweirdness.com and I'd love to have any and all visitors to the site.

I recently received promotional DVDs for the re-mix of Flash Gordon (1980 version) and hope to receive come of "Serenity" soon. The web site will have contests where you can win a sneak preview DVD, info on the show, drivel about drive-ins, horror movies, horror hosting, and web radio like cultradio-a-gogo.

FAQs re: Gunga Jim and his drive-in show==

1. What question are you asked most frequently re: your activities?
   A: Do you understand these rights as I've explained them to you?

2. Can I watch your show?
   A: You can if you live in Bloomington/Monroe County and have cable
      TV. It's on Channel 7 (CATS) Saturday nights at around 11:30 or
       whenever the staff there feel like it. The show will soon be
      available on veoh and youtube. DVD copies of the show are
      also available to order. See www.seriousweirdness.com

3. Do you do appearances?
   A: Only with a court order. No, seriously, I appear regularly at 
      and event called Cinema Wasteland held twice a year in 
      Strongsville, OH (just outside Cleveland). Plus, I hope to 
      soon put in appearances at Horror Hound weekend in Nov in Indy.

4. What is your main goal in life, Gunga?
   A: To be the first person publically executed by the Consumer
       Product Safety Commission. Barring that, I'd like to win
       Powerball and tell 99% of all people to kiss my fat hairy a...

Stay tuned. As soon as my new medication arrives, I'll post more.

Gunga Jim

Has Paris Hilton picked out her prison bitch name yet? I'll bet when she shows up at the Iron Bar Hotel, it'll be like parking the Oscar Meyer wiener truck outside the dog pound. woof woof.

GJ

4. The guy who knew he had an infectious disease acting as if he didn't know traveling around the world might be hazardous to others, claiming no one told him *explicitly* not to travel. Because of people like him, we have warning labels on cups of hot coffee.

"See, honey. Because of me they have a warning label." - Homer Simpson

I thought I'd start off a new entry (first in a long time) with a few observations/beefs:

1. The Grand Canyon is awesome. The view of earth from the moon is awesome. The amount of money we've spent on Iraq is awesome. Your wife stopping off to by some bread on the way home is *NOT* awesome. The Post Office holding your mail until Tuesday is *NOT* awesome. I swear, if I hear "awesome" to describe the mundane just once more...it's lampshade time! Awesome!

2. If only slipping thorazine into my co-workers' drinks wasn't considered "assault" by the local fuzz.

3. My name is Gunga Jim and I'm a "rage-a-holic"....YOU GOT A PROBLEM WITH THAT?!?!?!

Moron these and other beefs later....GJ

(quasi-ripoff from overheard conversation)

If gingerbread men live in gingerbread houses, isn't that like living in a house made of the same stuff as you? Wouldn't that be like living inside Oprah? Or maybe the family from Texas Chainsaw Massacre - armchairs made of arms, wallpaper and lampshades of human skin.....kinda like living with Iron Chef Gein.

Yours in plastic bandages, 
Gunga Jim

Been out of action for way too long with summer programs, vacation, oh..and..getting married. Yep. I decided 11 years between electroshock series was long enough and got hitched again. To the detriment of my drive-in TV show, web site, friendships, etc, I've been spending all my time on these.

But now....on to pillage--

I can't remember the last time I had this much fun. No, really. I can't remember a thing since I've been on my new meds. After having been around the world (Hong Kong Hilda knows what I mean by that *wink* *wink*), I've decided to spend more time on leisurely pursuits. Or was that "leisure suits"? (see previous notation re: meds). Be sure and drop by the web site: www.seriousweirdness.com for more updates as they happen. I'll try to keep up regular entries (as opposed to the usual "rear entries" - ibid).

Hi there, fellow travelers! This is Gunga Jim coming to y'all live from somewhere high in the mountains of Sikkim (which looks oddly like Indiana, despite the assurances of my travel agent).

I thought I'd take a few minutes before I dive into the slavegirl pool here at Gunga's Ashram for the Mentally Unbalanced and introduce myself. My hobbies are drive-in movies (I host a local drive-in theater on TV), reading, cataloging crustaceans for Red Lobster, writing my name in the snow and working with video. My dislikes are rude people, Indiana drivers, and people who try to see how long it takes for someone's lips to quit moving after being decapitated.

My fondest memories are of going to the drive-in every weekend in summers and learning to be "freewheelin'" as opposed to freebasing. I am now the kind of guy that likes to "let it all hang out." Which is probably why I'm not allowed on city buses any more.

Anyway....I'll be hanging around here some and hope to run into many interesting characters (at about 70 mph).

Love, Kisses, and some viral DNA segments
Gunga Jim
